DesignPattern.name: Singleton Multithreaded
DesignPattern.Description: The singleton pattern is a design pattern that restricts the Instantiation of a class to one object. If the client use the instance of the singleton, the singleton will return the same instance, every time. The multithreaded version sets a lock on the instance variable, until the lock is released, any other thread will be paused.
